txt.en: This golden statue of a horse and rider bears a strong resemblance to the Rohirrim. Céola will almost certainly wish to see it.

'What have you found there? What? I cannot believe this!

'This statue was made by the smiths of Gondor and given to Eorl the Young in honour of the aid he gave at the Field of Celebrant. It has long been an heirloom of the Eorlingas!

'How did this come to be in the hands of the brigands? Ah, that I think I can answer well enough: Gríma Wormtongue, no doubt. He probably gave it to Hafoc as a reward for betraying us all....'
Where Now the Horse and the Rider?
In the brigand's treasure-cave at Helstor, you found a golden statue of a horse and rider, which bears a strong resemblance to the Rohirrim.
Bring the statue to Céola at Etheburg in the Brown Lands
Céola is at Etheburg in the Brown Lands, south of Helstor.\n\nYou should bring the statue to Céola at once.
